channel.title: Need help on fixing SOURCE compiler
channel.description:
[code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
This is the problem I get when I try to run my SOURCE compiler. Can someone help me with fixing this?
- You can add me on skype if you can help me, my username is cameron.124

item.title: Need help on fixing SOURCE compiler
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

No, it’s not searching every ‘file’, you’re searching every ‘file directory’.
You can shorten your search by saying that it’s guaranteed to be in a file directory past ‘SERVERNAME/src/’, assuming you’re using a [PI] that is.

Most likely something at the end of the list on the compiler.
Example of a path to compile:

src\server\task\*.java

That’s going to search in the task folder for anything with a * file extension of .java.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help on fixing SOURCE compiler

item.title: Need help on fixing SOURCE compiler
item.dc:creator: @gamestop666 gamestop666
item.description:
@gamestop666 wrote:

I’m not sure what you mean lol. I mean how do I find the file path that contains no .java files? Do I have to search EVERY file?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help on fixing SOURCE compiler

item.title: Need help on fixing SOURCE compiler
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

There’s a line in that compiler that is specfiying a file path.
That file path contains no .java files :).
Just find the path and double check for java files, if no java files in the path simply remove that path from the compiler until a .java file is in there.

Read full topic
